p: Cinnamomum subavenium. Miq. belong to lauraceae family, which are popular in China, Malaysia, Cambodia, Indonesia, and Burma [ 6]. Its peel, fruit, and leaves have been used in folk medicine for treating stomachache, carcinomatous swelling, abdominal pain, chest pain, hernia, rheumatism, vomiting, nausea, and diarrhea [ 7]. Recently, researchers have reported that C. subavenium has potent cytotoxic effects in some tumor cell lines, including urothelial carcinoma cells, colorectal cancer cells, skin cancer melanoma cells, human bladder cancer cells, human lung cancer cell, and human prostate cancer cell lines [ 7â€“ 12]. Moreover, the leaf oil of C. subavenium has potent antioxidant and antimicrobial activities [ 13]. But, the anti-inflammatory activity of C. subavenium has not been report so far. Therefore, the objectives of our study were to investigate the major chemical composition of leaf oil from C. subavenium using gas chromatography-mass spectroscopy (GC-MS) and assess the anti-inflammatory activities of the leaf oil from C. subavenium (CS-LO).
